attachments.title: Serverless Meetup (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
attachments.text: A group for anyone interested in building web, mobile and Internet-of-Things applications with serverless architectures. We mostly focus on Amazon Web Services and discuss AWS Lambda as the focal poin

If you and Peter can make a small outline on what you would both like to touch on/teach/play-out in the session, do,  so then I could change/add more content around that -- deadline Wednesday --> Friday latest. <@U9GR3G88Y> here is the outline with the info we mainly discussed on Wed, there is a part I included for who I believe our target audience is. If I am missing something let me know - comment/edit on the doc. Deadline for you is latest Wed.. but feel free to send me demo versions before that <@UC46W9E77> have a browse as well and think of blurbs we can put for CTA posts, you can draft and send this to me latest Tuesday morning :stuck_out_tongue: [this is crucial as we would to have ample time to get the word out] If something is unclear, check-in with Loek, JH or me.   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/193cP_4YF6j8DI-HVmGSU14KnXmuOfnOtEimWSUttmEI/edit?usp=sharing>

<@U9GR3G88Y> <@U0D6EPESC> what do you think of this to partners/clients (Waag, Sanquin, Ultimaker, Rythm?, Wolfpack?, HR): <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ImOo_xGo2hhafylICIYHamj8d6c35uWiDbiOr_HD-Hg/edit?usp=sharing>

**Happy to receive feedback on our NEW Offcourse platform**

To all the life-long learners amongst you,

Me and the team at Offcourse are extremely proud to announce that we just relaunched our crowdlearning platform!
Many of you know that Offcouse started out as a passionate project of mine. I'm satisfied and humbled to see that it developed
into so much more.

I am not going to bore you with all the technical and design improvements that we have made over the last months.
As they say, one picture tells more than a thousand words:

<PICTURE>

But in case, you want to read about the process and its results anyways, you can find our blogpost about it here:

<LINK>

Nonetheless, there is always room for improvement, so we are happy to receive any feedback from you!

Let's continue to share knowledge and empower one another. If you have a course or valuable resources that you
would like to make easily accessible to others, check out our platform: <LINK>!

And if you need help improving knowledge sharing in your organisation, please contact me.

<@U0D6EPESC>
<@U8AM0S37E> <@UBE37B8JX> please check before sending....
Twitter Launch Anouncement

root.text: Not too bad, just trying to interact in whatever ways I can with relevant communities. I've steered away from the private messages now after all the feedback. I've managed to find a few individuals who I think could be of interest, and have been engaging with their tweets without it coming across as too much of an imposition, I'm hoping that something should come of some of them at some point soon! Did you have a chance to check out the second version of the platform relaunch I sent you?

<!channel> Hey guys, this is the current version of the visual identity; if any changes are needed, please let me know. How to work with a visual identity? Its quite simple, just make sure that any (external) communication complies with the visual identity. Therefore, make sure to use the right colors, use the right fonts (these are available on the Drive), to use the right tones. If you have got any doubts or questions on the matter, or just want to check whether your document complies with the visual identity, you can ask me for feedback on the visual part and/or <@UBE37B8JX> for feedback on the textual part. GOOD LUCK!
